strings.Value: {g|Population2_1}[Choice effects]{/g} "Drive this bandit from my lands, and from now on do the same to any similar petitioners!"
{g|Population2_2}[Choice effects]{/g} [Gain 50 BP] "Arrest this bandit and clap him in irons. The same fate awaits any like him!"
{g|Population2_3}[Choice effects]{/g} "I will accept this tribute. I hope this good lad and his colleagues will continue to share their revenue in the future."
"You know best what to do."

{n}Octavia looks alarmed.{/n} "You won't believe what just happened! Some crook showed up at your gates, insisting on seeing 'the {mf|lad|lass} who bumped off the Stag Lord'! He says that he's brought a tribute to the new chief of the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}, and asks for permission to conduct his 'business' under your protection!"
"You don't want to be seen as another Stag Lord, and your lands as an open field for thugs. Then throw this scoundrel out – along with his tribute!"

{n}Valerie enters the throne room, fiercely stabbing her heels into the floor as she approaches. She stands before you and simmering with indignation.{/n} "I would never have thought that I'd commence my career as Regent with such a case, but... the leader of a local gang is at your gate. He's brought a chest stuffed with stolen goods, which he wants to share with you – the new lord of the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}!"

"I insist this impudent man be immediately arrested and brought to justice. Your lands have a long and dark legacy, but your subjects fail to grasp that the times of cutthroats and extortionists are over, and law rules here, now and henceforth!" {n}Valerie flares her nostrils vehemently.{/n} "You will not protect these bandits as the Stag Lord did!"

{n}Lander smiles.{/n} "Oh, it's an amusing situation, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}! A former cohort of the Stag Lord – a simple local bandit – has come to pay us a visit. It seems that he and all the other bandits in the area believe that you are now the new lord of the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}. So they sent him to pay their respects. He even brings gifts!"

"He wishes to share his loot, so that in response you will permit him to conduct his, ahem, business in your territory. It's not a bad solution – I'm sure the bandits will pay generously for the right to be private tax-collectors. Of course, outside your lands some may look upon this as organized extortion – but what do you care about those stiffs from {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}?"
{n}Octavia nods.{/n} "Of course! I will indulge myself a bit, and let our citizens chase the crook to the city gates!"
"So these presumptuous criminals can run rampant in someone else's lands? Still, at least this may teach them half a lesson."

{n}Lander's face grows long.{/n} "Oh, come now! You can't react like this to every business proposal, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}!" {n}Lander sighs.{/n} "But of course, I will do as you say."
"You're in no mood for games today, I see! Fine, let it be so."
{n}Valerie catches her breath and allows a faint smile to show on her face.{/n} "I will carry out your orders with pleasure, {name}."

{n}The smile disappears from Lander's face.{/n} "Oh? I can't say this is a wise decision: there won't be any fewer bandits in your lands… they just won't be contributing to the treasury. But very well, it's up to you."

{n}Octavia opens her mouth, amazed, and for a moment seems to have lost her gift of speech.{/n} "So… so we what? Just let these scoundrels rob our poor citizens without fear? How can we allow this!?" {n}The girl looks at you anxiously.{/n} "I don't know what's got into you, but I don't like this at all!"
{n}Valerie's face turns morbid and pale. For a moment she struggles to say something, but in the end manages to force out only a single sentence, through gritted teeth.{/n} "As you wish."

{n}Lander rubs his hands together.{/n} "I'm sure your Treasurer will be glad of this decision! Your subjects are not only the plowmen, but also such adventurous folks as this one – and you can't just take away their wages!"
"Then this scoundrel and everyone like him can forget the way to these lands!"
"I will personally arrest this scoundrel, and see to it that his henchmen end up in prison cells beside him."
"In that case I shall accept the petitioner's gifts, and discuss further compensation with him."
